section: The Term of this Agreement shall be for a period of [* ****] years and [*****] months commencing the 1st day of September 2004 and terminating the [*****] day of [*****].
explanation: The contract term is not clearly defined because the exact number of years and months is redacted, as well as the termination date. Without knowing the length of the term or the termination date, it is impossible to determine the obligations and responsibilities of both parties over time. This is an ambiguity in the text because the end date is completely missing which makes the contract vague and open to interpretation, leading to potential disputes.

section:
MANDATORY PRODUCTS" shall mean the following ADAMS GOLF PRODUCTS that CONSULTANT must exclusively play/use in all Champions/Senior Professional Golf Association (SPGA) and Professional Golf Association (PGA) events at all times:

[***** ]  Confidential Material redacted and filed separately with the Commission.
explanation: The specific Mandatory Products are redacted. Without knowing which products are mandatory, it's impossible to enforce the clause requiring exclusive use of those products. There is a lack of clarity which leads to potential disagreements about which products the consultant is obligated to use, undermining the purpose of the 'Exclusive Use of Product' clause. The omission of the products that are listed as mandatory leads to a contradiction since it is referenced later on.

section: Notwithstanding paragraphs 4A, 4B and 4C above, CONSULTANT shall be entitled to endorse and play the [*****]. The parties expressly  agree that CONSULTANT may  permit [*****] the use of CONSULTANT'S  name and/or likeness in [*****] print and/or television advertisement provided that this is executed in a manner consistent with [*****] past  [*****] advertising practice using similarly situated professional golfers  with competing golf club endorsement agreements that include [*****]. If  [*****] use of CONSULTANT  varies from past practice of utilizing similarly situated professionals, CONSULTANT will take action to remedy the situation [*****]. If CONSULTANT participates directly in any [*****] sponsored photo shoots for advertising or PR, CONSULTANT shall wear his ADAMS GOLF [*****]. The parties further expressly agree that CONSULTANT'S endorsement of the [*****] shall not include the right to place a [*****] logo on his ADAMS GOLF [*****] or the ADAMS GOLF  [*****]. If CONSULTANT'S relationship with [*****] terminates during this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall be permitted to replace the [*****] endorsement with another [*****] endorsement under the same terms and conditions expressed herein.
explanation: This section provides an exception to the exclusivity clause, allowing the consultant to endorse a different product. However, the product that the consultant can endorse is redacted, creating an ambiguity. Without knowing the nature of the product being endorsed, it is impossible to determine if there is a conflict of interest with Adams Golf's products or if the endorsement is appropriate. Additionally, the parameters around how the consultant can endorse the product are also redacted, creating further ambiguity and leaving the parties open to interpretation.

section:
In each and every calendar year of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall achieve a satisfactory record of play in a minimum of [* ****] professional golf association events on the SPGA and/or PGA tour (which shall include both the PGA and SPGA Tour Skins Games). If for any reason, CONSULTANT should achieve a satisfactory record of play in less than [*****] SPGA and/or PGA tour events in a calendar year, he shall repay ADAMS GOLF an amount per event for each event under [*****] achieved in the given calendar year as follows:

The agreed upon repayment amount per event per calendar year:

1.  Year 1. $[*****] 2.  Year 2 $[*****] 3.  Year 3 $[*****] 4.  Year 4 $[*****] 5.  Year 5 $[*****]
explanation: The minimum number of events the consultant must play is redacted, as well as the repayment amount per event for each year of the agreement. Without knowing the minimum number of events, it is impossible to determine when the repayment clause is triggered. Also, not knowing the amount to be repaid makes the clause unenforceable because there is no way to accurately calculate the repayment amount. The omission of the products that are listed as mandatory leads to a contradiction since it is referenced later on.

section: During the term of this Agreement, CONSULTANT shall make himself available on not more than [*****]  days for television and radio commercials, photo shoots, modeling and  promotional appearances compatible with CONSULTANT'S  own practice, play and personal time requirements. Said activities shall  be directly related to the promotion of ADAMS GOLF PRODUCT. ADAMS GOLF  shall  reimburse CONSULTANT  for reasonable travel expenses for CONSULTANT when making special appearances for ADAMS GOLF pursuant to this paragraph but ADAMS GOLF shall not pay CONSULTANT session fees, residual payments or the like for television appearances. Travel expenses shall include jet fuel or first-class round-trip airfare and lodging, meals and local transportation.
explanation: The number of days the consultant is required to be available for promotional appearances is redacted. Without this number, it's difficult to determine the extent of the consultant's obligation and could lead to disputes over availability. The lack of a defined limit creates ambiguity, which has the potential to undermine the enforceability of this section of the agreement. It is important that this is defined.

section: For the entire term of this Agreement, from September 1, 2004 through [*****] ADAMS GOLF shall pay CONSULTANT a base compensation of [*****] dollars. The base compensation shall be paid [*****].
explanation: The end date of the compensation period is redacted as well as the amount of compensation that will be paid and how the compensation shall be paid. Without knowing when the agreement ends and the compensation that is supposed to be paid out, and how that compensation will be paid out, it is hard to properly follow the agreement. This section is ambiguous and incomplete.

section:
In addition to his base compensation, CONSULTANT shall also be entitled to bonuses based on performance in particular PGA and SPGA events and year-end standing as follows:

  1. If CONSULTANT wins a PGA Tour Major (consisting of the Masters, US Open, PGA and British Open) or the Champion's Tour (SPGA) US Open, CONSULTANT shall receive a bonus of $ [*****].

  2. If CONSULTANT wins a Champions/Seniors Tour (SPGA) major other than the US Open (which shall for the purposes of this agreement consist of the Senior PGA, Senior British, the Tradition and the Ford Seniors) CONSULTANT shall receive a bonus of $ [*****].

3. If CONSULTANT finishes in the top [*****] on the official year end money list of the Champion's Tour (SPGA), CONSULTANT shall also be entitled to a year end performance bonus according to the following schedule:

a.2005 $ [*****] b.2006$ [*****] c.2007$ [*****] d.2008$ [*****] e.2009$ [*****]
explanation: The bonus amounts for winning major tournaments and the year-end bonus schedule are redacted. Without knowing the specific bonus amounts, it's impossible to accurately calculate the total compensation due to the consultant. The redacted information undermines the enforceability and clarity of the bonus structure.

section: In the event of termination of this Agreement,  ADAMS  GOLF  shall cease using the name and/or likeness of CONSULTANT in advertising within [*****] days.
explanation: The timeframe within which Adams Golf must cease using the consultant's name and likeness in advertising is redacted. Without this information, it's unclear when the company must stop using the consultant's endorsement post-termination. This ambiguity makes it difficult to enforce this obligation.

section: In the event of termination of this Agreement,  ADAMS  GOLF  shall cease using the name and/or likeness of CONSULTANT on Product within [*****] months after termination of this Agreement.
explanation: The timeframe within which Adams Golf must cease using the consultant's name and likeness on products is redacted. Without this information, it's unclear when the company must stop using the consultant's endorsement post-termination. This ambiguity makes it difficult to enforce this obligation.
